key_points: Debate over the possible impact of race on the Capitol riot police response.
Mark Anthony Neal suggests the response would have differed if protesters were from Black Lives Matter.
Criticism of Capitol Police's preparedness and leadership under Steven Sund, who resigned.
Calls for an independent commission to investigate the Capitol riot, announced by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.
Comparison of law enforcement's response to Black Lives Matter protests versus Capitol riot.
During George Floyd protests, law enforcement often clashed with demonstrators despite mostly peaceful protests.
Capitol riot described as a failure of law enforcement, with poorly prepared Capitol Police.
Recent history shows different law enforcement responses to protests based on racial composition.
Michael Brown protests in Ferguson cited as an example of disproportionate police response.
The Capitol riot has prompted reconsideration of racism within law enforcement and American society.
spokespersons: Mark Anthony Neal (African American studies professor, Duke University)
Jeremy Pressman (Associate Professor of Political Science and Director of Middle East Studies, University of Connecticut)
Brad Garrett (ABC News contributor, Retired FBI agent)
Joe Biden (President of the United States)
